revised_title: Sceparnodon: An Extinct Marsupial with Unique Teeth
tldr: The author describes the unique teeth of an extinct marsupial, Sceparnodon, found in Australia. These teeth are rootless, ever-growing scalpriform incisors, which are different from other known species. The author compares the teeth's microscopic structure to that of other marsupials and rodents, finding a closer resemblance to the wombat. The discovery of Sceparnodon contributes to the understanding of the extinct marsupial fauna of Australia.
